reviews.review_text:
The Goan Spice offers a fantastic atmosphere with great vibes. The food is absolutely delicious, and every meal is a treat. However, the place tends to get crowded, so arriving early is recommended to fully enjoy the experience.

While the overall ambience and flavours are excellent, the service could use some improvement. At times, the staff seem inattentive, and a quicker, more efficient service would enhance the dining experience.

That said, the quality of the food and reasonable prices make it well worth the visit. If youâ€™re a fan of local delights, this place is highly recommended!

This place is overly crowded but I find it hard to believe that this is because of the food? I think it has to do more with the name and the location.

Customers are that many that waiters will make sure they take your order fast without investing in a more friendly environment. I felt as if I was in those Mumbai restaurants in which you eat and leave, rather the enjoying the whole experience of it.

Though food was not bad, I don't think it was great considering the rates. This place was not for me.

We were here very late in the night after an evening of binge drinking, partying and club hopping. We did not dine here and we ordered takeaway. The ambience here was great and the restrooms were clean. Ample parking space available right next to the restaurant in an empty plot. The restaurant has a separate bar section with good music and seating. The food was tasty and fulfilling. Ghee rice, Chicken Tikka and Chicken Lollipops were great. The Goan Fish thali was tasty and filling as well.
